sourceOfFunds.purpose: MGNREGA, under this scheme the farmers across 75 districts were taken into consideration wherein training and knowledge was provided to them to lower down the capital investment and use relatively simple techniques for farming. Technique which was taken up was Vermi Composting. Second work horticulture, the farmers were made aware of the techniques to grow fruits, flowers, and do gardening etc. in a way which does not harm the soil structure nor kills the nutrients.

Atharv welfare society was engaged in the medicine distribution and awareness program which was sponsored by the AYUSH DEPARTMENT. 1. This initiative covered almost 75 districts of U.P. under which medicines were distributed to the households for diseases like swing flu, dengue, Chikanguniya, Japanese encephalitis. Proper training to the workers was given before commencing the distribution process. The primary aim of Atharv welfare society is to keep the society healthy and growing.

Atharv focused on Agriculture. By the approval of Agriculture department U.P, the events and programs organized by Atharv welfare society focused majorly on Organic Farming and promoted organic farming techniques among the young farmers and countryman. Pearl farming, Honeybee farming and Sandalwood farming was major area of focus. The purpose of promoting organic farming among the farmers is to avoid artificial chemicals, pesticides and fertilizers which pose more risk to the soil.
